p:
Parents completed the Canadian Acute Respiratory Illness and Flu Scale (CARIFS)
22 questionnaire at scheduled visits (day 1–15), and responses were used to measure secondary efficacy endpoints including time to alleviation of signs and symptoms (TTASS) of influenza [defined as when a score of 0 (no problem) or 1 (minor problem) was reported for cough and nasal symptoms on the CARIFS questionnaire, return to normal health and activity, and return to afebrile state (tympanic temperature ≤37.2°C), remaining for at least 21.5 hours]. Subgroup analyses of TTASS based on virus subtype were also performed.
